defs: to join two or more things together in an orderly manner; to cause to be associated together.
to make ready (as by yoking a pair of oxen for ploughing or draughting a cart).
a small flat ornament, worn as a frontlet at the partition of hair in combing.
a slender, vertical mark of saffron (on the forehead).

the act of oozing, leaking out.

the act of emitting; issuance; a discharge.

to leak in drops; to ooze.

to stir as to make the sediment at the bottom of a water tank come up and make the water muddy.
youth - a) the period of life coming between teenage and maturity; b) the state or quality of being young, esp. of being vigorous and lively or immature, impetuous, etc.
either of two milk-secreting glands protruding from the upper, front part of a woman's body; a female breast.

of or resulting from the feelings or temperament of the subject or person thinking; not objective; personal; subjective.
a man understanding, perceiving or interpreting a thing or fact in relation to or based on his feelings, temperament, knowledge, circumstances, etc.
the philosophic theory that all knowledge is subjective and relative, never objective; subjectivism.
any philosophic theory that restricts knowledge in some way to the subjective elements, as by limiting external reality to what can be known or inferred by subjective standards of truth.
an ethical theory holding that personal attitudes and feelings are the sole determinants of moral and aesthetic values.
